item.title: [SOLR-1299] In distributed search cannot search on any schema field in ascending order (descending is OK)
item.description:

http://localhost:8983/solr/select/?q=*:*&sort=timestamp+desc&fsv=true

comments.comment:
Confirming that it is a bug.

I guess the problem is that after SOLR-1111, MissingStringLastComparatorSource extends FieldComparatorSource instead of SortComparatorSource, therefore SortField#getFactory returns null. This causes NPE when doing a custom sort in distributed search.
This affects all schema fields (not just date)

Shalin,

Are you picking this one up, or should we try to dig into it? Not an area I'm familiar with but can start tracing through...

Here's a patch which adds a fix and a test which fails without the change. I added a new comparator method which mimics the MissingStringLastComparatorSource before SOLR-1111.

I don't know much about distributed search to know if this is the "right" fix. I wouldn't commit this until Yonik reviews and approves.

Perhaps we should use FieldComparatorSource/FieldComparator since ScoreDocComparator will be going away in 3.0?
Hard coding to missingStringLast probably won't work for everything either.

Perhaps we could do
fcomp = FieldComparator.newComparator(String fieldname, int numHits=1, int sortPos=1, boolean reversed=false)

then to get the values, do something like

// whenever reader changes
fcomp.setNextReader(IndexReader reader, int docBase, int numSlotsFull=1?)
fcomp.copy(int slot=0, int doc=docToGetValueOf)
Comparable val = fcomp.value(slot=0)

This is closest to how the existing method works.
Longer term, the right way may be to record the sort field values when the search is done (via FieldDoc)
Many thanks Shalin. Your fix works for us.
I just assigned this issue to myself a few hours ago - I wish "All" was the JIRA default so we would see stuff like that by default...
You do see it with Lucene assigns don't you? Is Solr set differently?

You do see it with Lucene assigns don't you? Is Solr set differently?

I think it's the same for both projects... you don't see svn commits and assigns inline with the rest of the comments unless you click the "All" tab. But the "Comments" tab is the default.

Patch attached.
This uses the new Lucene FieldComparator classes and thus we can delete all of the previously copy-n-pasted code from Lucene. It also uncovered (and fixed) bug in our SortMissingLast comparator:

     public Comparable value(int slot) {
       Comparable v = values[slot];
-      return v==null ? nullVal : null;
+      return v==null ? nullVal : v;
     }
